page.title: 05ACTIVITIES CENTRE, UFFCULME
page.content: Built in{1837}this building started life as a local{brewery}and the premises were linked by a bridge across the road to the{Trafalgar {Works.}Since this time it has been used for a variety of{industrial {purposes.}It was a billet for {American soldiers}during{World War {Two}and was last used commercially by a soft toy manufacturer.The premises was taken on a ten year lease in{February 1984}by the{Uffculme Trust as project sponsors with funding provided by the{MSC.}It now provides { business and leisure courses}for local people,mainly the{unemployed, and aims to teach useful skills. These include woodwork, metalwork, printing, computers, photography and various handicrafts. There is a coffee bar and many children's activities. About 140 people use the building each week.
